metadata.title: CVE-2020-27845 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
There's a flaw in src/lib/openjp2/pi.c of openjpeg in versions prior to2.4.0. If an attacker is able to provide untrusted input to openjpeg'sconversion/encoding functionality, they could cause an out-of-bounds read.The highest impact of this flaw is to application availability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-27845` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenjp2-7 - 2.3.1-1ubuntu4.20.04.1
libopenjp2-tools - 2.3.1-1ubuntu4.20.04.1
libopenjp3d-tools - 2.3.1-1ubuntu4.20.04.1
libopenjp3d7 - 2.3.1-1ubuntu4.20.04.1
libopenjpip-dec-server - 2.3.1-1ubuntu4.20.04.1
libopenjpip-server - 2.3.1-1ubuntu4.20.04.1
libopenjpip-viewer - 2.3.1-1ubuntu4.20.04.1
libopenjpip7 - 2.3.1-1ubuntu4.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openjpeg2 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.3.1-1ubuntu4.20.04.1').
insighttoolkit4 package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
qtwebengine-opensource-src package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
texmaker package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
